errorConnectionErrorApp.message: Cannot connect to KeeWeb, please check if KeeWeb is open and browser integration is enabled in settings.

errorConnectionErrorWeb.message: Cannot connect to KeeWeb, refreshing a tab with KeeWeb may help. Inspect the extension background page to get more details.

errorBrowserTabNoPermissions.message: Permission to access $1 was not granted.

errorRequestTimeout.message: KeeWeb didn't respond to our request in time.

optionsIntro.message: This is a browser extension for KeeWeb, a free cross-platform manager compatible with KeePass.

optionsConnectionModeApp.message: Using the native app. This is the most convenient mode of integration: KeeWeb runs in background, the extension connects to the app to fetch credentials. If you don't have the app installed:

optionsConnectionModeAppOnly.message: To use the extension, your need to install KeeWeb app. The app is running in background and the extension connects to it to fetch passwords. If you don't have the app installed:

optionsConnectionModeWeb.message: Web-only: you need to have a tab with KeeWeb open, the extension connects to this tab. It's less convenient, however you don't have to install a desktop app:

optionsWebConnectionTabPermission.message: To connect to the KeeWeb tab, we need a special permission, otherwise it won't be possible to communicate with this tab. Click this button to grant the necessary permission to the extension:

optionsWebConnectionKeeWebUrl.message: KeeWeb URL (change it if you're using your own self-hosted version):

optionsWebConnectionKeeWebUrlNotHttps.message: The URL must start with https://

optionsUsageIntro.message: Now when you're successfully connected to KeeWeb, it's time to use the extension!

optionsUsageButton.message: Put your cursor to a field on any page, then click the extension button to auto-fill the form:

optionsUsageShortcut.message: Instead of clicking the button, you can also use a keyboard shortcut that you can change below.

optionsUsageShortcutNoChange.message: Instead of clicking the button, you can also use a keyboard shortcut $1.

optionsUsagePermissionsPerSite.message: Sometimes additional permissions are required to auto-fill passwords. If you see this warning sign, click the extension button to grant necessary permissions:

optionsUsageMenu.message: Alternatively, select a desired option from the KeeWeb menu:

optionsShortcutsDescription.message: You can change shortcuts in the extension shortcuts settings.

optionsShortcutsDescriptionNoChange.message: You can use these shortcuts to submit forms faster.

optionsShortcutsManual.message: To edit shortcuts, open add-ons in your browser, then click the settings button, and select the shortcuts item:

optionsAboutContact.message: You can ask a question, suggest an idea, or submit an issue report here:

optionsAboutLicense.message: This extension is licensed under MIT. It includes these awesome libraries:
